After 3 days, just open & mix well.. now, it's time to taste ğŸ™‚Â I can't explain more it tastes awesome ğŸ‘ŒğŸ‘ŒğŸ‘©ğŸ»â€ğŸ³ Side dish : Mango Pickle | Andhra cuisineÂ  Quantity: approx ~ 1 kilograms Â Duration: 20 mins Let's start with ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Raw mangoes - 3 - diced - 800 gms
  • Red chilly powder - 60 gms
  • Salt - 60 gms
  • Sunflower Oil - 80 ml
  • Dry Roasted Mustard seeds - 1 tb sp
  • Dry Roasted Fenugreek seeds - 1 tb sp
For tempering:
  • Brown chickpeas/ kala Chana Â - 1 tb sp
  • Garlic cloves - crushed - 4 to 5
  • Mustard seeds - 1 tsp
  • Oil - 1 tb sp
Procedure: Pre-preparation: Dry roasted Seeds:
  • Heat skillet pan over medium heat
  • Dry roasted mustard seeds & fenugreek seeds separately
  • Keep them aside and let them cool down
  • Add them in blender till smooth powder
  • Keep it aside
Mangoes:
  • Wash mangoes and wipe off wet with paper towel or kitchen towel.. for pickle you need clean & dry mangoes
  • Chop sides of mangoes and discard seed ( center part of Mango) and cut into pieces
  • Diced mangoes are ready for pickle, Keep aside
Tempering for Pickle:
  • Heat tempering pan over low to medium heat
  • Add oil, mustard seeds & brown chickpeas
  • let them splutter and add garlic cloves
  • Saute & turn off heat when garlic cloves turns lite golden brown
  • Keep it aside and let it become cool
Process of making Mango Pickle:
  • Take a mixing bowl
  • Add diced mangoes, salt, red chilly powder, mustard seeds and fenugreek seeds powder
  • Mix well, add tempering and oil
  • Mix well and fill in an airtight container
  • Keep it aside upto 3 days and let it soak all the flavours
  • After 3 days open it , gently mix and Store in any pickle container or Jaadi
  • You can preserve upto one year ğŸ˜ŠğŸ‘
  • Happy cooking and enjoy your day â˜€ï¸

  • I used Store bought red chilly powder, you can also use homemade red chilly powder
